title: Need help to convince my teacher to set up a high school league club

embed.description: Do you want to join a club or start your own? Check out the directory to see if your school is listed and how you can get started if it isn't.

body:
Hey fellow summoners,

I was just wondering if anyone here has successfully started the high school league club and wondering what they would of said to the teachers to convince them to sign up for this. If anyone knows what i should say to the teachers please let me know. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Please comment any ideas thanks :)

replies.body:
Pretty sure it's for universities. If you are in a public school you are out of luck because the Government only allows the original Dota to be played.

Private schools are different however. If I still had the document I used I would give it to you but i deleted it a few years back.

> [{quoted}](name=Akivir,realm=OCE,application-id=NjEElsTI,discussion-id=RuEKhN43,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-07-21T09:24:43.283+0000)
>
> Pretty sure it's for universities. If you are in a public school you are out of luck because the Government only allows the original Dota to be played.
> 
> Private schools are different however. If I still had the document I used I would give it to you but i deleted it a few years back.

The collegiate program is for universities; but there's also a high school program that supports high school clubs separately.

I think linking your teachers to some of the ["teacher stories"](http://promo.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/high-school-clubs/teacher-stories.html) would be a good idea. That way they can hear directly from other teachers how a League club will benefit the school.

Also make sure you describe League as a community and e-sport, rather than just a video game. A lot of teachers might be a bit old fashioned and assume _video games = waste of time_.

If after all that your teacher is still not convinced, I could have a talk with **Riot Maraudaur** and see if maybe he can help us a bit :D

i been talking to riot maraudaur and i have also shown a few teachers the teacher stories

Oh damn, and you still couldn't get a school club made?

That's a shame, but don't let it hold you back. There's so many other options for clubs now days. You could make a in-game club for you and your friends, or join an online community like [this](http://www.sectorfour.co/) one.
